alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 24 at 3:18AM MDT until May 24 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND HIGHLANDS, WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Low level moisture will be shunted to the east Tuesday as gusty northwest winds associated with a passing storm system usher in a drier and more unstable air mass over western New Mexico and portions of central New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, and Middle Rio Grande Valley from 1 PM Tuesday afternoon through 8 PM Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 6 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
